poem:
Title: "Borders Built of Hatred, Singed"

Identitarian breathes shards of ice,
Emissary of estrangement. Distant hills hold him,
Switzerland, Germany - barred. 
Chained to his cause, unyielding signpost.
Potsdam's ink stains, notations of naught. 
Across nations, a chorus rises,
Echo of protests, humankind's hopeful hymn.
Untethered from his land, but tethered still,
In his video-ed echo, a hollow ringin', 
A vacant vast, whispering of belonging.
